job_details.Functieomschrijving:
Outlier helps the world's most innovative companies improve their AI models by providing human feedback. Are you an experienced software engineer who would like to lend your coding expertise to train AI models?We partner with organizations to train AI large language models, helping cutting-edge generative AI models write better code., guidelinesPayment:Currently, pay rates for core project work by coding experts range from USD $25 to $50 per hour.
       Rates vary based on expertise, skills assessment, location, project need, and other factors. For example, higher rates may be offered to PhDs. For non-core work, such as during initial project onboarding or project overtime phases, lower rates may apply.
       Certain projects offer incentive payments. Please review the payment terms for each project.PLEASE NOTE: We collect, retain and use personal data for our professional business purposes, including notifying you of opportunities that may be of interest and sharing with our affiliates.
       We limit the personal data we collect to that which we believe is appropriate and necessary to manage applicants' needs, provide our services, and comply with applicable laws. Any information we collect in connection with your application will be treated in accordance with the Outlier Privacy Policy and our internal policies and programs designed to protect personal data.This is a 1099 contract opportunity on the Outlier.ai platform.
       Because this is a freelance opportunity, we do not offer internships, sponsorship, or employment. You must be authorized to work in your country of residence. If you are an international student, you may be able to sign up for Outlier if you are on a visa.
       You should contact your tax and/or immigration advisor with specific questions regarding your circumstances..
job_details.full_text:
Back End Developer- AI Trainer (Dutch)

Outlier helps the world's most innovative companies improve their AI models by providing human feedback. Are you an experienced software engineer who would like to lend your coding expertise to train AI models?We partner with organizations to train AI large language models, helping cutting-edge generative AI models write better code., guidelinesPayment:Currently, pay rates for core project work by coding experts range from USD $25 to $50 per hour.
       Rates vary based on expertise, skills assessment, location, project need, and other factors. For example, higher rates may be offered to PhDs. For non-core work, such as during initial project onboarding or project overtime phases, lower rates may apply.
       Certain projects offer incentive payments. Please review the payment terms for each project.PLEASE NOTE: We collect, retain and use personal data for our professional business purposes, including notifying you of opportunities that may be of interest and sharing with our affiliates.
       We limit the personal data we collect to that which we believe is appropriate and necessary to manage applicants' needs, provide our services, and comply with applicable laws. Any information we collect in connection with your application will be treated in accordance with the Outlier Privacy Policy and our internal policies and programs designed to protect personal data.This is a 1099 contract opportunity on the Outlier.ai platform.
       Because this is a freelance opportunity, we do not offer internships, sponsorship, or employment. You must be authorized to work in your country of residence. If you are an international student, you may be able to sign up for Outlier if you are on a visa.
       You should contact your tax and/or immigration advisor with specific questions regarding your circumstances..

profile_classification.rationale: The job description focuses on providing human feedback to train AI models and mentions 'coding experts' but does not detail specific engineering tasks like model development, deployment, or advanced software engineering for AI applications. It primarily describes a role that uses coding expertise to assist in AI training through human feedback, which aligns with the 'use of AI tools to enhance productivity' aspect of the Ambiguous profile, rather than a dedicated engineering role.

job_tasks.justification: The phrase 'improve their AI models by providing human feedback' and 'partner with organizations to train AI large language models' indicates an understanding of how human input contributes to business goals in AI development.
job_tasks.phrase: improve their AI models by providing human feedback

job_tasks.justification: The phrase 'helping cutting-edge generative AI models write better code' shows an understanding of the business application and goal of improving AI capabilities.
job_tasks.phrase: helping cutting-edge generative AI models write better code

job_tasks.justification: The core activity described is 'train AI models' and 'train AI large language models', which falls under the modeling category, even if the specific technical implementation is not detailed.
The phrase 'lending your coding expertise to train AI models' directly links coding skills to the process of model training.
job_tasks.phrase: lending your coding expertise to train AI models

job_tasks.justification: The description mentions 'experienced software engineer' and 'coding expertise', implying a background in software development, though the specific tasks are focused on training rather than building applications.
